service.description: Service properties for the Nexus service on DC/OS.

name.description: The name of this DC/OS service.

cpus.description: CPU shares to allocate to Nexus.

mem.description: Memory (in MB) to allocate to Nexus.

resource-role.description: The accepted resource role. Change to "slave_public" role if it should run on an public agent.

networking.description: Networking properties for the Nexus service on DC/OS.

host-port.description: The host port to map the Nexus service. A value of 0 will randomly assign a value for host port.

pinned-hostname.description: An optional DC/OS agent hostname to run this Nexus instance on (e.g. 10.0.0.1). If this is not specified then the task may relaunch on another node than the one it originally ran on.

storage.description: Storage properties for the Nexus service on DC/OS.

persist.description: Whether to use DC/OS persist Nexus data. If false, all Nexus data and state is ephemeral and will not be shared between Nexus instances. By default, this is false.

local-volume.description: Local volumes configuration (only used if external persistent volumes are disabled). Please read Pre-Install Notes for setup for local volumes.

host-volume.description: The location of a volume on the host to be used for persisting Nexus configuration and data.

external-volume.description: External volumes configuration. Uses the REX-Ray volume driver.

enable.description: Whether to use DC/OS external volumes to persist Nexus data. By default, this is false.

volume-name.description: The name of the volume (this will be created if it doesn't already exist).
